sentences.en: A mosquito had bitten her and her arm had swollen up.
sentences.cn: 蚊子叮了她,她的手臂肿起来了.

sentences.en: An army swollen with pride is bound to lose.

sentences.cn: 她的布满斑点的浮肿的脸

sentences.en: Her eyes were all red and swollen from crying.
sentences.cn: 她两只眼睛哭得又红又肿.

sentences.en: Her eyes were red and swollen from crying.
Her face is blotched and swollen.
sentences.cn: 她脸上长斑，而且肿起来了。

sentences.en: Her glands were swollen and painful.
Her legs had got swollen from standing up all day.
sentences.cn: 因为整天站着,她的双腿已经肿了.

sentences.en: His eyes were swollen from crying.
His throat began to feel swollen and constricted.
sentences.cn: 他开始觉得喉咙肿胀发紧。

sentences.en: Its population is swollen by 360,000 refugees.
Money supply has been swollen by a large capital inflow.
sentences.cn: 由于资金的大量流入货币供应已大增.

sentences.en: My eyes were so swollen I could hardly see.
sentences.cn: 我的眼睛肿得很厉害，几乎看不到东西。

sentences.en: The bridge was washed away by the swollen river.
sentences.cn: 桥给上涨的河水冲走了.

sentences.en: The sky, swollen like a black bladder, rumbled and crackled.
sentences.cn: 天空中乌云黑沉沉地压下来，发出隆隆声和噼啪声。

sentences.en: Your neck looks swollen; let me have a feel.
sentences.cn: 你的脖子似乎肿了起来, 让我摸摸看.

words.tran_cn: 肿胀的，浮肿的；浮夸的；激动兴奋的

trans.tran_en: a part of your body that is swollen is bigger than usual, especially because you are ill or injured

trans.tran_cn: 增强，肿胀，鼓起(swell的过去分词)
